media.caption: Participants in the Dartmouth Summer AI Workshop (1956) Credit

text.headline: The Dartmouth Summer Workshop
text.text:
'...proceed on the basis of the conjecture that every aspect of learning or any other feature of intelligence can in principle be so precisely described that a machine can be made to simulate it'

A Proposal for the Dartmouth Summer Research Project on Artificial Intelligence

media.caption: Garry Kasparov Confronts Deep Blue (1997) Credit

text.headline: Deep Blue Defeats Garry Kasparov
text.text: 'I could see the trend... I could see that it's, you know, a one-way street. That's why I was preaching for collaboration with the machines, recognising that in the games' environment, humans [are] doomed.' - Garry Kasparov

text.headline: AlphaGo Defeats Lee Sedol
text.text: '...there is an entity that cannot be defeated' - Lee Sedol

media.caption: Ken Jennings, Watson, and Brad Rutter (2011) Credit

text.headline: Watson Dethrones Human Jeopardy Champions
text.text: '"Quiz show contestant" may be the first job made redundant by Watson, but I'm sure it won't be the last' - Ken Jennings

text.headline: McCullough and Pitts describe Neural Nets
text.text: In principle, a neural net is capable of computing any function a digital computer can

media.caption: A perceptron which is key for neural nets Credit

text.headline: First Trainable Neural Network
text.text: Psychologist Frank Rosenblatt demonstrates the Preceptron which had a design similar to the modern nueral net with adjustable weights and thresholds

text.headline: World's First Chatbot
text.text: ELIZA represented an early implementation of natural language processing created by Joseph Weizenbaum

media.caption: Stanley created by Stanford University is the first autonomous vehicle to complete the DARPA challenge Credit

text.headline: Five Vehicles Complete the DARPA Grand Challenge
text.text: Just one year after the DARPA Grand Challenge inception, five vehicles finished the challenge and all but one vehicle surpassed the 11.78 km (7.32 mi) distance completed by the best vehicle in the 2004 race

media.caption: Cat pictures used for learningCredit

text.headline: Deep Learning Used to Identify Cats
text.text: Researchers at Stanford build on multilayer neural nets in Building High-Level Features Using Large Scale Unsupervised Learning where unsupervised learning was used to identify cats

media.caption: Humans and Computers were given a unique image to copy Credit

text.headline: Machines Can Outperform Humans when Recognizing Images
text.text: The annual ImageNet demonstrated that machines could outperform humans for a narrow set of vision-related tasks

media.caption: Waymo One a commercial robotaxi service Credit

text.headline: Self-driving Cars Hit the Road
text.text: Waymo's self-driving taxi service hits the road in Phoenix, Arizona
